page.title: 09Heron Corn Mill
page.content: As far back as Saxon Times use was made of the dramatic drop in the river at Beetham. Heron Corn Mill was rebuilt in seventeen-forty. The miller and his two sons ran it. It is now a working museum that closes in the Winter,but the curator is prepared to open any time if the party raises a minimum of five pounds. The busiest time of the year is in the childrens Summer holidays. the mill is built of local stone and has been carefully maintained. Up on the top floor is a fantastic working model of three different water wheels. When the same flow of water is passed over them we see that the wheel with the greatest radius moves the most.
